text: Asda Stores Ltd. is a British supermarket chain. It sells frozen fruit, meat, groceries, vegetables, fruit, clothes, frozen foods, electronics, party and homeware and general merchandise at a very cheap price. In 1999, It became a subsidiary of the American retail giant Walmart, the worldâ€™s largest store, Asda was the second-largest supermarket chain in the United Kingdom between 2003 and 2014, after 2014 it fell into third place. In 2019, A potential merger with Sainsbury's was proposed, but did not happen. In 2021, the brand was sold to the Issa Brothers, with Walmart holding a 10% stake in Asda. == References == Category:1965 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:Organisations based in Leeds Category:Supermarkets of the United Kingdom
title: Asda
